Are you sure you want to shut down Hermes system? This will stop messages transmission and reception.

Login Use your required credentials to access the HERMES system. e.g. Username: hermes Password: hermes1234 Your credentials were created and provided beforehand, most likely. If you have no access to this information or you forgot your password contact for the system administrator.

Voice Use the voice panel to communicate via voice PTT (push to talk). Step - Use the step button or select the number to easily change the frequency of the radio. Volume - Volume control to regulate the speaker volume. Reset Protection - For proper functioning the protection must be OFF. When the radio turns the protection ON that means the antenna does not match the transmission frequency. You can reset the protection selecting (Reset). Mode - You can change the operating mode (USB/LSB) by toggling the Mode option button. Timeout - When the timout finish the voice will be interrupted, by clicking on the screen or on any option the timeout restart *Note: If the SWR is too high, transmit a test signal. Go to Radio configuration, turn ON the PTT button. Check the Power level (should be between 15W and 30W). Check the SWR (should be less than 2.0). Check the Protection (should be OFF). After the readings, click to turn OFF the PTT button. If the protection stays OFF after the transmission test, and the Power and SWR readings are in the correct ranges, the HERMES system is ready for operation. If either Power and SWR are not in the correct ranges or if the protection is on, check the equipment, including: the cables (condition and proper connections), the radio (cable connections, voltage between 12 - 14v, temperature of radio, smell of burning), the antenna condition.

Messages List of public messages received. Hermes system allows transmission of text and files between connected stations, through public messages, sent through this interface or private messages, though the Deltachat application or webmail interface. On the Messages page you can see the public and sent messages option. If you have system permissions you can send a new message to another station selecting the button NEW.

Sent messages List of sent messages, outbox. *Note: When a sent message appears in this list it does not mean the message was received by the destination or even transmitted. Check the transmission list to verify the transmission status of your sent messages.
Message The message received detail allows you to see all message information: title, message, file, date and time, origin and destinations. Select the reply button to answer the message.

New message Compose a new message with title (subject) and description (message). When composing a new message you can protect messages with a password before sending by clicking 'protect message' and attach files by clicking 'select file'.

Attach file Attach a file to your message. It is possible to attach images, audio recordings, documents, etc. By clicking 'select file'. Accepted formats: The system will accept all types of files. For images and audio files the size limit is 31.45 MB, for other kinds of files the size limit is 20.48 kB. If the file will not attach, check the file size, if it is too large the user should send another smaller file. *Note: The system will compress attachments, however, message packages greater than 71.68 MB will not be transmitted.

Protected message *Note: If the message is protected, type the correct password ( defined previously by the emitter/origin) to access the message content. It is important to note that the emitter and the receiver should previously agree which password to use for those cases.

Protect message Protecting the message with a password means the recipient will be required to enter the same password. The receiver must know the password to read the entire message and access the attached file. If you password protect the message, you must be sure the password is shared with the recipient. Otherwise they will not be able to open the message.

Email On the Email page you can find the Webmail system, Deltachat, downloads and the stations email list. You can also find emergency email contacts for unexpected or emergency situations. *Note: To access the webmail you have to use the same credentials used to access the HERMES system.

Deltachat Through the Deltachat app, you can use emails to conduct personal message exchanges (similar to WhatsApp or SMS). Keep in mind that due to the scheduling of transmission of the messages, they may take a while to arrive, depending on the amount of messages in the queue and the gateway station's schedule of operation. The HERMES system includes a compression system. End-to-end encryption should be disabled in order to allow the server-based image and audio compression to work properly, otherwise image and audio exchange will not be possible. The steps to find this feature in Deltachat are: -> Advanced -> Autocrypt, Prefer End-To-End Encryption: turn off. delivered. If you wish, you can also turn on email delivery monitoring to check if your emails were correctly sent. Deltachat, by default, tags its emails and show only the "known" messages (emails) that was sent by another Deltachat application. In order to be able to interact with e-mails from any e-mail client software, enable the option "show all emails". The steps to find this feature in Deltachat are: Burger Menu ( ) -> Settings -> Chats and Media -> Show Classic E-Mails -> All. After tag Show All Classic E-Mails you must turn off the read receipts in the same screen (Settings -> Chats and Media -> Read Receipts) to avoid receipts that will consume your band and storage with large confirmation e-mails. In order to configure DeltaChat, first an e-mail account should be created, on the creat user session, acessed trhough admin or email link on the main menu. In order to login to an e-mail account, only the e-mail address and password fields should be filled, as shown below. The user and password will be the same as those created when first creating a login on HERMES and for use with the RoundCube webmail, such as: username@ .

Radio Configuration The Radio Configuration page you can find all information about the Radio Voice and Data transmission. Radio Status - radio connection status (connected / disconnected). Radio profile - current radio mode operation profile (voice / data) Data frequency - Frequency used to transmit messages and files. All stations need to be on the same frequency so they can communicate with each other. *Note: Changing the frequency can stop or interrupt the sending and reception of transmissions. Voice frequency - Frequency used to transmit (PTT) and receive voice transmission. SWR - Standing Wave Ratio. This indicates how efficiently power is transmitted from the radio transmitter to the antenna. A low SWR (close to 1) indicates that the antenna is set to the correct operating frequency and the system will operate efficiently. A high SWR (2.5 or above) suggests that the antenna is not set to the same frequency as the transmitter or that it is damaged. The transmission will not be optimal and trying to operate the system with a high SWR can damage the transmitter and will likely cause the radio to go into protection Mode. Power - It is best practice to use the minimum power needed to make contact. Using a lower power setting can shorten the transmission range and preserve battery capacity. Operation mode (TX/RX) - TX stands for transmitter and RX stands for receiver. The mode is available for data and voice transmission separately. Serial Number - Identifies your radio equipments unique serial number.
Data frequency Data frequency for messages and files transmission. Note: Changing the frequency can stop or interrupt the sending and reception of transmissions.
Voice frequency Voice frequency for voice usage. *Note: This frequency is not related to the message and emails transmission and only applies to voice transmission and reception.
Threshold Threshold of SWR allowed. If the SWR level goes above (of 2.5) this threshold protection will be enabled and transmission will halt.
Mode The radio can operate on two different modes USB / LSB. All stations need to be on the same mode so they can communicate with each other optimally.

Radio Profile Toggle the radio profile button to choose the radio operation mode profile. Voice radio or data transmission. *Note: If the radio data is connected transmitting you cannot change the profile for voice. Please wait until the transmission finishes.

PTT (Push to talk) Push To Talk. PPT should remain OFF unless it is being used for testing. This function simulates pressing the PTT button on the physical microphone. Used only for testing purposes when tuning the system.
Reboot Reboot the HERMES system by clicking the Reboot button.

Reset to default Select Reset to Reset/restore your radio to the default HERMES configuration. You will not lose your messages. *Note: Restoring your radio to the default configurations can stop or interrupt sending and reception of transmissions.

Reset protection If the SWR goes above the threshold set on Protection activation threshold level this function will halt transmission to avoid damage to the equipment. Click reset to resume system operation, having first reviewed why the system went over the threshold. *Note: If the SWR is too high, transmit a test signal. Go to Radio configuration, turn ON the PTT button. Check the Power level (should be between 15W and 30W). Check the SWR (should be less than 2.0). Check the Protection (should be OFF). After the readings, click to turn OFF the PTT button. If the protection stays OFF after the transmission test, and the Power and SWR readings are in the correct ranges, the HERMES system is ready for operation. If either Power and SWR are not in the correct ranges or if the protection is on, check the equipment, including: the cables (condition and proper connections), the radio (cable connections, voltage between 12 - 14v, temperature of radio, smell of burning), the antenna condition.

User management In User management you can update your own information (Phone number and password) or delete your user. If you are an administrator you can create, update and delete all users with exception of the root user. *Note: if you delete your user credentials you won't be able to access the HERMES system anymore.

Message Configuration Manage which user profile has permission to send messages and attach files. Lost files can consume your storage, clean broken files to free your storage by clicking 'Clean up lost files' and eliminate unnecessary files.

Transmission schedule Manage your transmission schedules, by time period and station name. As communication between stations is unidirectional, transmissions must be scheduled to happen according to the central station, alternating between reception and transmission with different stations at different times. Keep in mind that due to the scheduling of transmission of the messages, they may take a while to arrive, depending on the amount of messages in the queue and the gateway station's schedule of operation.

Transmission list When you press send on a message, it is a transmission queue before its final destination. A system administrator can cancel the messages in the queue before they are sent, and also delete the sent and received messages. Deleting sent and received messages periodically can help avoid the hard drive from filling up. In an emergency, the system administrator can force message transmission of the queue by clicking on the "force" button. This can interrupt receiving messages on the Gateway from other stations for a while.

Stations Information Manage the stations network, giving nicknames for each station and configuring the preferred transmission data frequency and mode for each connection or enable and disable connections. Alias - Station identification. Nickname - Name for easy or representative identification. Status - Connection status between stations. Frequency - Preferred data frequency for connection between stations. Mode - Preferred mode for connection between stations (USB/LSB).

Wi-Fi & Ethernet manager Wi-Fi & Ethernet manager, configure Wi-Fi SSID (network name), change password and check Wi-Fi and ethernet information. *Note: Changing the SSID or the Wi-Fi password will disconnect everybody from the Wi-Fi network.

Troubleshooting To know what to do in case of an error, you first need to know which component is causing the problem. To find out if the problem is with the device connecting to the network (cell phone, tablet, computer), the easiest way is to test access from another device, or from another browser on the same device. If the problem is only with you, it is possible that the problem is in the network settings of your device. Check below the necessary settings to access the HERMES network: If this does not solve your problem, try cleaning your browser's history and logging in again, or change browsers. If none of this resolves the problem, it is possible that your device is incompatible with the network. In case of problem in the Antenna, a LED will light up on the server box, in this case, check the correct position of the power supply wires and check the position and integrity of the Antenna, coaxial cable, and the transmitter. If the messages in the transmission list are not being transmit, check if the radio settings have been changed, in which case it could be that the other stations are offline or on a different frequency. To remedy you could restore the factory default settings. If the problem is with the data radio, there will be an error message when the administrator goes into Administration -> radio configuration. If you receive a message saying server offline, your equipment is likely turned off. If the message persists, it could be that some part of the system is corrupted. In this case, you may need to take your equipment to a place with internet for online maintenance. *Note: If the SWR is too high, transmit a test signal. Go to Radio configuration, turn ON the PTT button. Check the Power level (should be between 15W and 30W). Check the SWR (should be less than 2.0). Check the Protection (should be OFF). After the readings, click to turn OFF the PTT button. If the protection stays OFF after the transmission test, and the Power and SWR readings are in the correct ranges, the HERMES system is ready for operation. If either Power and SWR are not in the correct ranges or if the protection is on, check the equipment, including: the cables (condition and proper connections), the radio (cable connections, voltage between 12 - 14v, temperature of radio, smell of burning), the antenna condition.

Media Access Control (MAC) A Media Access Control (MAC) address, sometimes referred to as a hardware or physical address, is a unique, 12-character alphanumeric attribute that is used to identify individual electronic devices on a network. In this section you can enable or disable the MAC verification in reason of restrict the WiFi access. Add a new MAC address to provide access permission to the Wi-Fi HERMES for a unique device. An example of a MAC address is: 00-B0-D0-63-C2-26.
